newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's Goodale to act on study of CWB by October.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Goodale to act on study of CWB by October.

text.p: Canada's Agriculture Minister Ralph Goodale plans to act on a federal export panel's recommendations on the Canadian Wheat Board's role in grain marketing by the end of October, a ministerial spokesman said.
"He said he'd like to get whatever required legislative changes introduced before the end of October," Goodale spokesman Vern Greenshields said.

The Western Grain Marketing Panel on July 9 suggested removing the CWB's monopoly on feed barley exports, pricing up to a quarter of milling wheat on the spot market and revamping the agency's corporate structure.
Goodale asked producers and other industry participants to send written reactions on the recommendations to him by the end of August before he would decide what to do.
